title: [BUG] mlflow.projects.run can't recognize local URI
body:
### Willingness to contribute

Yes. I can contribute a fix for this bug independently.

### MLflow version

1.26.1

### System information

- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Windows 10
- **Python version**: 3.10.4
- **yarn version, if running the dev UI**: N/A


### Describe the problem

I'm recreating the hyperparameter optimization project from https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/tree/master/examples/hyperparam , i.e. I have coded all the files from scratch on my local machine, and I am running into the following problem while invoking the `search_random.py` script using the command `mlflow -e random --experiment-id 2 . --env-manager local` from the root directory of the project.

The error:
```python-traceback
File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\git\cmd.py", line 502, in wait
    raise GitCommandError(remove_password_if_present(self.args), status, errstr)
git.exc.GitCommandError: Cmd('git') failed due to: exit code(128)
  cmdline: git fetch -v --depth=1 origin
  stderr: 'fatal: 'D:/MyStuff/Learn/MachineLearning/MLFlow/LearnMLFlow/tut2' does not appear to be a git repository
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.'
```

Through some debugging, I found that the exception is thrown at the point in the code where run an instance of the `train.py` script on the new thread:

```python
with mlflow.start_run(nested=True) as child_run:
    p = mlflow.projects.run(
        run_id=child_run.info.run_id,
        uri=".",
        entry_point="train",
        parameters={
            "training_data": training_data,
            "epochs": str(nepochs),
            "learning_rate": str(lr),
            "momentum": str(momentum),
            "seed": str(seed),
        },
        experiment_id=experiment_id,
        synchronous=False,
        env_manager='local'
    )
    succeeded = p.wait()
```

Specifically, the exception is thrown on the `p.wait()` call. I can't seem to understand why MLFlow thinks the project is at a remote repository even though I've specified the `uri` for the project as the current directory in the constructor. I've also tried replacing the `.` with the absolute path of the project directory, but the error persists.

### Tracking information

_No response_

### Code to reproduce issue

```python
with mlflow.start_run(nested=True) as child_run:
    p = mlflow.projects.run(
        run_id=child_run.info.run_id,
        uri=".",
        entry_point="train",
        parameters={
            "training_data": training_data,
            "epochs": str(nepochs),
            "learning_rate": str(lr),
            "momentum": str(momentum),
            "seed": str(seed),
        },
        experiment_id=experiment_id,
        synchronous=False,
        env_manager='local'
    )
    succeeded = p.wait()
```

### Other info / logs

```python-traceback
2022/05/31 03:07:45 INFO mlflow.projects.utils: === Created directory C:\Users\dhruv\AppData\Local\Temp\tmphzol9g4d for downloading remote URIs passed to arguments of type 'path' ===
2022/05/31 03:07:45 INFO mlflow.projects.backend.local: === Running command 'python search_random.py  http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/wine-quality/winequality-white.csv --max-runs 8 --max-p 2 --epochs 32 --metric rmse --seed 97531' in run with ID '6e2312ed5b914f32b933f160035dc3cf' ===
2022/05/31 03:07:48 INFO mlflow.projects.utils: === Fetching project from D:\MyStuff\Learn\MachineLearning\MLFlow\LearnMLFlow\tut2 into C:\Users\dhruv\AppData\Local\Temp\tmpg0sm6lo5 ===
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "D:\MyStuff\Learn\MachineLearning\MLFlow\LearnMLFlow\tut2\search_random.py", line 123, in <module>
    run()
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 1130, in __call__
    return self.main(*args, **kwargs)
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 1055, in main
    rv = self.invoke(ctx)
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 1404, in invoke
    return ctx.invoke(self.callback, **ctx.params)
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\click\core.py", line 760, in invoke
    return __callback(*args, **kwargs)
  File "D:\MyStuff\Learn\MachineLearning\MLFlow\LearnMLFlow\tut2\search_random.py", line 90, in run
    _, null_train_loss, null_val_loss, null_test_loss = new_eval(0, experiment_id)((0, 0))
  File "D:\MyStuff\Learn\MachineLearning\MLFlow\LearnMLFlow\tut2\search_random.py", line 47, in eval
    p = mlflow.projects.run(
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\mlflow\projects\__init__.py", line 331, in run
    submitted_run_obj = _run(
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\mlflow\projects\__init__.py", line 95, in _run
    submitted_run = backend.run(
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\mlflow\projects\backend\local.py", line 64, in run
    work_dir = fetch_and_validate_project(project_uri, version, entry_point, params)
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\mlflow\projects\utils.py", line 130, in fetch_and_validate_project
    work_dir = _fetch_project(uri=uri, version=version)
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\mlflow\projects\utils.py", line 164, in _fetch_project
    _fetch_git_repo(parsed_uri, version, dst_dir)
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\mlflow\projects\utils.py", line 202, in _fetch_git_repo
    origin.fetch(depth=GIT_FETCH_DEPTH)
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\git\remote.py", line 886, in fetch
    res = self._get_fetch_info_from_stderr(proc, progress,
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\git\remote.py", line 750, in _get_fetch_info_from_stderr
    proc.wait(stderr=stderr_text)
  File "D:\Softwares\Anaconda\envs\mlflow\lib\site-packages\git\cmd.py", line 502, in wait
    raise GitCommandError(remove_password_if_present(self.args), status, errstr)
git.exc.GitCommandError: Cmd('git') failed due to: exit code(128)
  cmdline: git fetch -v --depth=1 origin
  stderr: 'fatal: 'D:/MyStuff/Learn/MachineLearning/MLFlow/LearnMLFlow/tut2' does not appear to be a git repository
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.'
2022/05/31 03:07:49 ERROR mlflow.cli: === Run (ID '6e2312ed5b914f32b933f160035dc3cf') failed ===
```

### What component(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/artifacts`: Artifact stores and artifact logging
- [ ] `area/build`: Build and test infrastructure for MLflow
- [ ] `area/docs`: MLflow documentation pages
- [ ] `area/examples`: Example code
- [ ] `area/model-registry`: Model Registry service, APIs, and the fluent client calls for Model Registry
- [ ] `area/models`: MLmodel format, model serialization/deserialization, flavors
- [X] `area/projects`: MLproject format, project running backends
- [ ] `area/scoring`: MLflow Model server, model deployment tools, Spark UDFs
- [ ] `area/server-infra`: MLflow Tracking server backend
- [ ] `area/tracking`: Tracking Service, tracking client APIs, autologging

### What interface(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `area/uiux`: Front-end, user experience, plotting, JavaScript, JavaScript dev server
- [ ] `area/docker`: Docker use across MLflow's components, such as MLflow Projects and MLflow Models
- [ ] `area/sqlalchemy`: Use of SQLAlchemy in the Tracking Service or Model Registry
- [X] `area/windows`: Windows support

### What language(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `language/r`: R APIs and clients
- [ ] `language/java`: Java APIs and clients
- [X] `language/new`: Proposals for new client languages

### What integration(s) does this bug affect?

- [ ] `integrations/azure`: Azure and Azure ML integrations
- [ ] `integrations/sagemaker`: SageMaker integrations
- [ ] `integrations/databricks`: Databricks integrations
